chapter1.title: Wireless Attacks
chapter1.background: A cozy, bustling café interior during daytime with warm lighting, wooden tables, coffee cups, laptops, and people chatting. In the background, visible Wi-Fi signals represented as glowing waves emanating from routers, with one router looking suspicious with red glowing edges. Outdoor view through windows showing a city street.

characters.mira: A confident young woman in her 20s with long dark hair, wearing a casual hoodie and jeans, holding a laptop with a determined expression. She has a backpack with tech gadgets and a coffee cup in hand.
characters.alice: A friendly young woman with curly hair, wearing glasses and a sweater, looking worried at her laptop screen with pop-up windows visible.
characters.friends: A group of diverse young people (2-3) sitting at tables, some with laptops, others with phones, looking concerned or curious.

objects.laptops: Modern laptops with glowing screens showing terminal windows and network scanning tools.
objects.routers: Two wireless routers - one normal looking, one with ominous red lights and fake labels.
objects.coffee_shop: Café elements: espresso machine, pastries, chalkboard menu, Wi-Fi sign.

step1.specific_scene: Mira pointing at a laptop screen showing two identical Wi-Fi networks, Alice looking shocked, terminal window displaying airodump-ng output with highlighted suspicious MAC addresses.

step2.specific_scene: Mira using aireplay-ng command, deauth packets visualized as lightning bolts striking a fake router, friends cheering in background.

step3.specific_scene: Mira capturing WPA2 handshake, screen showing four-way handshake packets as glowing data streams.

step4.specific_scene: Mira analyzing beacon intervals, graphs and charts on screen showing abnormal patterns, suspicious router in corner.

step5.specific_scene: Mira updating MAC whitelist, screen showing approved device list, friends' devices connecting safely.

chapter2.title: Information Gathering
chapter2.background: Same café setting but with more technical elements - network diagrams on walls, multiple computers, server racks visible in background. Evening lighting with screens casting blue glow.

characters.mira: Same as chapter1 but more focused, wearing glasses now, taking notes on a tablet.
characters.tech_friends: Group of 3-4 friends with various tech setups - one with network cables, another with monitoring tools.

objects.network_tools: nmap, arp-scan outputs on screens, subnet maps, host enumeration results.
objects.servers: Router with multiple ports, DHCP server, DNS server represented as glowing boxes.
objects.threat_indicators: Red warning icons for suspicious hosts, traffic graphs showing anomalies.

step6.specific_scene: Mira running nmap scan, screen showing live hosts popping up like targets in a game, suspicious MAC highlighted.

step7.specific_scene: Mira probing router ports, firewall visualization with ports opening/closing, hidden management interface revealed.

step8.specific_scene: DHCP traffic capture, multiple DHCP offers visualized as competing signals, rogue server identified.

step9.specific_scene: DNS queries flowing like rivers, poisoned responses shown as corrupted data streams.

step10.specific_scene: SSID map expanding like a radar, duplicate networks appearing as clones, suspicious ones flagged.

chapter3.title: Vulnerability Analysis
chapter3.background: High-tech lab setting within the café - vulnerability scanners, security dashboards, code on screens. Dim lighting with multiple monitors showing scan results.

characters.mira: Professional look with lab coat over casual clothes, holding clipboard with vulnerability checklist.
characters.security_team: Small team including Mira and 2-3 others analyzing scan results.

objects.scanners: Nessus interface, SSL certificates, SQL injection payloads, HTTP headers displayed.
objects.vulnerabilities: Visual representations of security holes - cracked locks, broken shields, warning signs.
objects.patches: Code patches, security updates visualized as shields and locks being applied.

step11.specific_scene: Nessus scan running, progress bar filling, vulnerabilities appearing as red dots on a network map.

step12.specific_scene: SSL certificate chain displayed, expired cert shown as crumbling document, replacement cert glowing.

step13.specific_scene: SQL injection attempt, database tables exposed, input sanitization visualized as filters.

step14.specific_scene: HTTP headers list, security headers added like armor pieces, clickjacking prevented.

step15.specific_scene: Default credentials being changed, lock icons replacing weak passwords, strong passwords generated.

chapter4.title: Web Applications
chapter4.background: Web development workspace - multiple browser windows, code editors, web forms on screens. Creative but technical atmosphere.

characters.mira: Coder look with keyboard, mouse, multiple browser tabs open.
characters.web_users: Friends testing web forms, some frustrated with errors, others successful.

objects.web_elements: Login forms, hidden fields, redirects, directory listings, admin panels.
objects.security_features: CSP headers, input validation, secure redirects visualized as protective barriers.

step16.specific_scene: Form source code revealed, hidden fields exposed like hidden treasures, being removed.

step17.specific_scene: JavaScript disabled, form validation bypassed, server-side validation added as backup.

step18.specific_scene: Redirect URL manipulated, phishing site blocked, whitelist enforced.

step19.specific_scene: Directory listing exposed, files hidden behind locked door, browsing disabled.

step20.specific_scene: Admin panel brute-forced, rate limiting added as speed bumps, strong auth enforced.

chapter5.title: Exploitation Tools
chapter5.background: Dark, intense hacker lab - multiple terminals, exploit frameworks running, target systems visualized. Dramatic lighting.

characters.mira: Serious expression, typing furiously, surrounded by technical readouts.
characters.targets: Server systems represented as fortified castles being tested.

objects.exploit_tools: Metasploit console, msfvenom payloads, searchsploit results, custom exploits.
objects.defenses: Firewalls, IDS systems, patched vulnerabilities shown as reinforced walls.

step21.specific_scene: Metasploit auxiliary module running, HTTP login tested, endpoint secured.

step22.specific_scene: ARP spoofing demonstrated, traffic hijacked, DAI enabled as protective shield.

step23.specific_scene: Path traversal exploited, file system accessed, input validation added.

step24.specific_scene: SearchSploit results, CVE details, patch applied like healing a wound.

step25.specific_scene: msfvenom payload created, reverse shell blocked, egress filtering enforced.

chapter6.title: Password Attacks
chapter6.background: Fortress-like setting with password vaults, cracking tools, hash representations. Medieval castle meets modern tech.

characters.mira: Guard stance, protecting password vaults, testing attack tools.
characters.attackers: Abstract representations of cracking attempts, blocked by defenses.

objects.passwords: Hash strings, rainbow tables, cracking tools, strong password generators.
objects.defenses: MFA, lockouts, salted hashes visualized as impregnable walls.

step26.specific_scene: WPA2 handshake cracked, new strong PSK set, rotation policy implemented.

step27.specific_scene: Hydra brute-forcing, account lockout triggered, MFA enabled.

step28.specific_scene: SSH brute-force attempt, password auth disabled, key-based auth enforced.

step29.specific_scene: MD5 hash cracked, migrated to bcrypt, salting added.

step30.specific_scene: Rainbow table attack, salts rendered useless, per-user salts implemented.

chapter7.title: Reverse Engineering
chapter7.background: High-tech disassembly lab - firmware images, binary code, analysis tools. Clean, precise environment.

characters.mira: Analyst with magnifying glass, examining code, taking detailed notes.
characters.binaries: Firmware represented as complex machinery being taken apart.

objects.analysis_tools: Ghidra interface, Binwalk output, strings results, decompiled code.
objects.firmware: Router firmware, embedded secrets, backdoors revealed.

step31.specific_scene: Binwalk extracting firmware, hidden files revealed, Ghidra analysis.

step32.specific_scene: Embedded credentials found, patched out, secure login enforced.

step33.specific_scene: Auth bypass patched, control flow corrected, firmware rebuilt.

step34.specific_scene: Debug tokens discovered, revoked, firmware updated.

step35.specific_scene: Patched firmware signed, securely flashed, integrity verified.

chapter8.title: Social Engineering
chapter8.background: Office/meeting room setting with training materials, phishing examples, awareness posters. Collaborative atmosphere.

characters.mira: Trainer role, presenting to group, demonstrating attacks and defenses.
characters.staff: Diverse group learning about social engineering, some falling for demos.

objects.phishing: Fake emails, malicious links, training materials, awareness campaigns.
objects.defenses: CSRF tokens, caller ID verification, USB policies.

step36.specific_scene: Phishing email analyzed, site taken down, staff training session.

step37.specific_scene: CSRF token implemented, cross-site requests blocked.

step38.specific_scene: Voicemail spoof detected, verification protocols deployed.

step39.specific_scene: BLE beacons scanned, rogue ones blocked, auth enforced.

step40.specific_scene: USB autorun disabled, user training conducted, policies set.

chapter9.title: Sniffing & Spoofing
chapter9.background: Network monitoring center - packet captures, traffic analysis, spoofing demonstrations. High-tech surveillance feel.

characters.mira: Network analyst, monitoring traffic, detecting anomalies.
characters.traffic: Data packets visualized as flowing streams, some corrupted or spoofed.

objects.network_tools: Wireshark captures, tcpdump output, Bettercap interface, scapy scripts.
objects.attacks: ARP spoofing, DNS poisoning, HTTP injection represented as attacks.

step41.specific_scene: Guest traffic sniffed, cleartext leaks identified, HTTPS enforced.

step42.specific_scene: DNS poisoning detected, cache flushed, DNSSEC enabled.

step43.specific_scene: ARP spoof test, DAI enabled, traffic protected.

step44.specific_scene: JS injection tested, CSP implemented, payloads filtered.

step45.specific_scene: DHCP spoof simulated, snooping configured, rogue blocked.

chapter10.title: Post Exploitation
chapter10.background: Incident response center - cleanup tools, recovery procedures, security hardening. Urgent but organized atmosphere.

characters.mira: Incident responder, coordinating cleanup, implementing fixes.
characters.compromised_systems: Systems shown as damaged but being repaired.

objects.cleanup_tools: Cron job removers, hash deleters, account auditors, log restorers.
objects.recovery: Backups restored, permissions fixed, monitoring enabled.

step46.specific_scene: Malicious cronjob removed, crontab restricted to admins.

step47.specific_scene: Hash dumps deleted, file permissions locked down.

step48.specific_scene: Backdoor account deleted, passwords rotated, monitoring added.

step49.specific_scene: Logs restored from backups, immutable logging configured.

step50.specific_scene: DNS tunneling detected, rate limits applied, monitoring set.

chapter11.title: Forensics
chapter11.background: Digital forensics lab - evidence boards, timeline displays, analysis tools. CSI-style investigation room.

characters.mira: Forensic investigator, examining evidence, building timeline.
characters.evidence: Log files, memory dumps, browser caches, timelines.

objects.forensic_tools: Volatility, extundelete, Plaso, Wireshark, timeline builders.
objects.artifacts: Deleted files recovered, memory analyzed, caches inspected.

step51.specific_scene: Deleted auth logs recovered, integrity verified.

step52.specific_scene: Memory dump analyzed, unauthorized processes terminated.

step54.specific_scene: ARP cache timeline built, rogue MAC isolated.

step55.specific_scene: Event timeline merged, intrusion markers identified, gaps secured.
